episodes.description:
It's been a year of me living on my own for the very first time. Crazy that it falls on the Libra eclipse. Anyway, please celebrate with me, and listen to:
- How I knew it was time to separate/divorce
- How did "the talk" go?
- How did I feel afterwards?
- Do I regret it?
- What have I learned/done in this last year?
- My advice for women wondering if they should leave too

Former, ICOC Staff member, Tania Diaz, is joined by her sister and former ICOC member, YAo Diaz, to talk about their time in the International Churches of Christ and what happened when Tania dared to get too determined about speaking out for justice, in light of recent lawsuits.

episodes.title: Deconstruction and Loss of Community with David Hayward (aka NakedPastor)
episodes.description:
Questioning your faith and leaving your "church family" can be an overwhelming and even scary undertaking. 

What will I do without the friends I've had for YEARS?
How will I survive if I lose EVERYTHING?
How will I ever find another church?
Do I even want to find another church?
What does it mean for my salvation if I'm not going to church?
What about all those "one another" scriptures?
...and more!

The NakedPastor (one word!) joins us to talk about entering and traveling through the wilderness of deconstruction (and what to be on the lookout for when it comes to people who want to teach you how to deconstruct).

episodes.title: ICOC series: Hierarchy and Leader Worship
episodes.description:
*****TRIGGER WARNING******

The experiences described in this video detail instances of spiritual, emotional, and psychological abuse. If you feel yourself getting triggered, please pause to be able to process and reset. 


1- We warned you there may be profanity, but there is none! 
2- We have laid eyes on the Hampton Roads response to the rolling stones article. It includes the following verbiage:
"The leadership of the HRC takes these accusations and others like them seriously. If childhood sexual abuse is reported to any of our staff members, our process includes reporting the incident to legal authorities, as required by the laws of the state of Virginia. If any member has knowledge of childhood sexual abuse or any other criminal activity in the HRC, we encourage them to discuss it with a staff member or elder. At present we are not aware of any childhood sexual abuse incidents in the HRC or other churches in the ACR or in the ICOC churches." 

and

"We also anticipate that those who have previously written or posted negative opinions about the ICOC churches may use the article to further their discussions on social media. We would encourage you to not get involved in arguments based on speculation and rumor, online or otherwise. Instead, we encourage you to pray for all involved in the lawsuits and for the church and its leadership to respond with love and wisdom."

So......there you go.
